# beginSearchInteraction()

**Instance Method**

Starts a search interaction and moves the keyboard focus to the search field.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func beginSearchInteraction()
```

## Discussion

If the system displays a compressed search field, starting the search interaction expands the field to the width stored in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSearchToolbarItem/preferredWidthForSearchField] property and moves the keyboard focus into the search field. Use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSearchToolbarItem/beginSearchInteraction()] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSearchToolbarItem/endSearchInteraction()] to programmatically control a search.

## Controlling search interactions

- **endSearchInteraction()**: Ends a search interaction by giving up the first responder and adjusting the size of the search field to the available width for the toolbar item if necessary.
